body:
If we annotate stuff in `torch` with this then that would end up compiling a bunch of graphs that may or may not be used, whereas this only compiles ones that are used in a script as necessary.

Variable closing works the same as in strong scripts (i.e. will throw an error for non-constant values)
body_html:
If we annotate stuff in torch with this then that would end up compiling a bunch of graphs that may or may not be used, whereas this only compiles ones that are used in a script as necessary.

Variable closing works the same as in strong scripts (i.e. will throw an error for non-constant values)
body_text:
If we annotate stuff in torch with this then that would end up compiling a bunch of graphs that may or may not be used, whereas this only compiles ones that are used in a script as necessary.
Variable closing works the same as in strong scripts (i.e. will throw an error for non-constant values)
